title: Analyzing graph to find work done on gas

content.question: One mole of an ideal gas is sealed in a cylindrical container with a movable piston. The volume and pressure of the gas are recorded as the gas is taken through process <math alttext="A B C A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the graph. Which of the following features of the graph, if any, is equivalent to the amount of work done on the gas during the complete cycle?

The area under the line <math alttext="A B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
The area bound by the triangle <math alttext="A B C A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

The average slope of the lines <math alttext="A B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="C A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
